maltese.text: Do well and forget it; do ill and remember it.
You can't buy heaven with money.
You cannot serve God and the devil.
You must kill the spider to get rid of the cobweb.
Your soul to God, your body to dust, your property to your relatives, because thus it has been found written.
He who doesn't fart, lets out silent ones.
He who follows his wife's advice will never see the face of god.
He who goes to bed hungry dreams of pancakes.
He who has had no experience of evil cannot know the worth of what is good.
He who loves suffers.
He who makes a fool of himself on account of a woman is well nigh ruined.
I am dead. It is as if everybody were dead. Let the man left behind shut the door if he wants to.
If god doesnt take a lawyer, the devil will haul him away.
If the man lets a woman know what he has got in his saving box, she will marry him for his money.
If you don't eat you will die; overeating will shorten your life.
Death spares no one.
Do good and forget it; do ill and remember it.
Don't marry a good-looking bride for you'll have to watch her.
Dont make sauce before catching fish.
Enjoy yourself, for there is nothing in the world we can call our own.
Every bird is proud of its feathers.
Far from the eye, far from the heart.
Good health is the sister of beauty.
He is a fool who does not consider his own interests.
He who does not fart lets out silent ones.
In the world there are more insane than sane.
In this world a pint of sweetness and a barrel of bitterness.
Its better to drive four horses than a donkey.
Its the fool wholl get you in trouble.
Life is a farce.
Long skirts carry dust, but short skirts carry away souls.
Love is blind.
Malta would be a nice place, if every knight were a tree.
Man is a faggot of thorns.
Marriage is a lick of honey and a barrel of bitter.
A cry and a sniff, and all comes to naught.
A cry, a sniff, and all comes to naught.
A cup must be bitter that a smile will not sweeten.
A good mule can be sold in his own territory.
A handful of dust, four capitals and shit on all i possessed.
A kiss without a hug is like a flower without the fragrance.
A lovely girl attracts attention by her good looks, an ugly girl by the help of a mirror.
A man and a sheaf of straw make two.
A man's heart is a forest.
A neck without a head, buttocks without a hole and a girl without shame are not worth admiring or marrying.
A woman can raise you to heaven and can dump you in hell.
A woman has even cheated the devil.
A woman has got seven souls.
A woman is like a lemon; you squeeze her and throw her away.
A woman who does not understand by a look of the eye won't understand by a box of the fist.
A womans tongue cracks bones.
After bad weather comes fine weather.
After taking ninety-nine years to climb a stairway, the tortoise falls and says there is a curse on haste.
All is well that ends well.
An oven whose door does not shut does not bake its loaves.
When a miser dies, the heirs feel as happy as when they kill a pig.
When it's raining and the sun shines -- then a Turk is born.
When the cock is euphoric, the brain is amnesic.
When the husband is a hen and the wife is a cock, the house is topsy-turvy.
Where the heart loves, there the legs walk.
With money you can build a road in the sea.
With money you can build aï¿½ road in the sea.
With money you can make a road in the sea.
Without money you can neither hug nor kiss.
Women have got long hair and short sense.
The good die young.
The law is not made for the rich.
The one who has had no experience of evil cannot know the worth of what is good.
The person who thinks about his own grief forgets about the grief of others.
The seller has one eye, the buyer, one hundred.
The wagtail hops and flaps its wings, but the male dove feeds and coos.
The wallet of the timid man neither increases nor decreases.
The weather vane will not work without wind.
The world is a wheel and men are the fellowes, and the devil prowling around spins.
The world is nonsense: what looks beautiful in the morning looks ugly in the evening.
The world teaches you more than your task-master.
There is no rose without thorns.
Time gives good advice.
Today me, tomorrow you.
Today you; tomorrow me.
We are all equal before death.
We are all flesh and blood.
What was is no more, what if is just if.
Whatsoever a new bride touches is fragrant.
Only death is certain.
Only fools and horses work.
Prickly pear trees dont produce peaches.
See a sheaf of corn in the morning and a young woman in the evening.
Seven women in their right senses are surpassed by a mad man.
The cat and the rat never thought alike.
The evil weed produces the largest number of weeds.
The good cow gets sold in its own country.
The good die first: And those, whose hearts are dry as summer dust, Burn to the socket.
Marriage without love-making means sad consequences and sorrow.
Marriage without lovemaking means sad consequences and sorrow.
Marry a man older than you and not a younger man, who will tire of you.
Money begets money, and fleas beget fleas.
Money has wings.
Mountain does not meet mountain, but a face meets another face.
No one takes away anything with him.
Once you put onï¿½ the wedding ring you must submit to all that is necessary.
One man's death is another man's life.
One man's fault is another man's lesson.
Asking is the sister of knowing.
At night all women are alike.
Believe not a swearing man and a weeping woman.
Better an ache than a tear.
Better an old but wise man than a young but foolish man.
Burn a good maltese; let alone a bad one.
Charm is stronger than beauty.
Chasten thy son while there is hope.
Death rights everything.
Death said to the man with his throat cut, "How ugly you look."
He who thinks about his own grief forgets about the grief of others.
The world is a wheel and men are the felloes, and the devil prowling around spins.
The world teaches you more than your taskmaster.
One manâs fault is another manâs lesson.
The world teaches you more than your supervisor.
A kiss without a hug is like a flower without fragrance.
You canât buy heaven with money.
Enjoy yourself; for there is nothing in the world we can call our own.
A good cow gets sold in its own country.
Arm ourselves for war? No! All the arms we need are for hugging.
If you donât eat you will die; overeating will shorten your life.
We are all equal before death.
Only death is certain.
One manâs death is another manâs life.
Death rights everything.
Death said to the man with his throat cut, "How ugly you look.
When the husband is a hen and the wife is a cock, the house is topsy-turvy
When itâs raining and the sun shines â then a Turk is born.
One manâs death is another manâs life.
